SEARCH
Package io.github.mangila.ensure4j

Class Ensure

java.lang.Object
io.github.mangila.ensure4j.Ensure
public final class Ensure extends Object

Utility class providing static methods to handle pre- and post-conditions
Ensure also brings utility methods for pre- and post-conditions during a functional programming pipeline/Java Stream so it can also return a value

  • Method Details

    • equals

      public static void equals(Object object, Object other, Supplier<RuntimeException> supplier) throws RuntimeException
      Compares two objects for equality and throws a provided exception if they are not equal. If both objects are the same instance or the first object equals the second, the method returns without exception. If the first object is null or the objects are not equal, a custom exception is thrown.
      Parameters:
      object - the first object to compare, must not be null
      other - the second object to compare with the first one
      supplier - the supplier providing the exception to be thrown if objects are not equal
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the first object is null or the objects are not equal

    • equals

      public static void equals(Object object, Object other, String exceptionMessage) throws EnsureException
      Compares two objects for equality and throws an EnsureException with the specified message if they are not equal.
      Parameters:
      object - the first object to compare
      other - the second object to compare
      exceptionMessage - the message to include in the EnsureException if the objects are not equal
      Throws:
      EnsureException - if the objects are not equal

    • equals

      public static void equals(Object object, Object other) throws EnsureException
      Asserts that two objects are equal. If they are not equal, an exception is thrown.
      Parameters:
      object - the first object to compare
      other - the second object to compare
      Throws:
      EnsureException - with the message "objects must be equal" - if the objects are not equal

    • notContainsNull

      public static void notContainsNull(Collection<?> collection, Supplier<RuntimeException> supplier) throws EnsureException
      Checks if the provided collection does not contain any null elements. If the collection contains a null element, an exception is thrown using the provided supplier.
      NOTE: No check if the collection is empty is performed.
      Parameters:
      collection - the collection to be checked for null elements
      supplier - the supplier of the exception to be thrown if a null element is found
      Throws:
      EnsureException - if the collection contains a null element

    • notContainsNull

      public static void notContainsNull(Collection<?> collection, String exceptionMessage) throws EnsureException
      Ensures that the provided collection does not contain any null elements.
      NOTE: No check if the collection is empty is performed.
      Parameters:
      collection - the collection to be checked for null elements
      exceptionMessage - the message to be used in the exception if the condition is violated
      Throws:
      EnsureException - if the collection contains null elements

    • notContainsNull

      public static void notContainsNull(Collection<?> collection) throws EnsureException
      Ensures that the provided collection does not contain any null elements.
      NOTE: No check if the collection is empty is performed.
      Parameters:
      collection - the collection to be checked for null elements
      Throws:
      EnsureException - with the message "collection must not contain null elements" - if the collection contains a null element

    • notEmpty

      public static void notEmpty(Collection<?> collection, Supplier<RuntimeException> supplier) throws RuntimeException
      Validates that the provided collection is not null and not empty. If the collection is null or empty, a RuntimeException is thrown, which is either created using the provided supplier or thrown directly if the supplier is null.
      Parameters:
      collection - the collection to be validated
      supplier - the supplier providing the RuntimeException to be thrown if the collection is null or empty
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the collection is null or empty

    • notEmpty

      public static void notEmpty(Collection<?> collection, String exceptionMessage) throws EnsureException
      Validates that the provided collection is not null and not empty. If the collection is null or empty, an EnsureException is thrown, which is either created using the provided supplier or thrown directly if the supplier is null.
      Parameters:
      collection - the collection to check for non-emptiness
      exceptionMessage - the exception message to use if the collection is empty
      Throws:
      EnsureException - if the collection is empty

    • notEmpty

      public static void notEmpty(Collection<?> collection) throws EnsureException
      Validates that the provided collection is not null and not empty. If the collection is null or empty, an EnsureException is thrown, which is either created using the provided supplier or thrown directly if the supplier is null.
      Parameters:
      collection - the collection to validate for non-emptiness
      Throws:
      EnsureException - with the message "collection must not be empty" - if the collection is empty

    • notEmpty

      public static void notEmpty(Map<?,?> map, Supplier<RuntimeException> supplier) throws RuntimeException
      Validates that the provided map is not empty. If the map is null or empty, the exception provided by the supplied supplier is thrown.
      Parameters:
      map - the map to be validated
      supplier - the supplier that provides the exception to be thrown if the validation fails
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the map is null or empty

    • notEmpty

      public static void notEmpty(Map<?,?> map, String exceptionMessage) throws EnsureException
      Ensures that the provided map is not empty. If the map is null or empty, throws an EnsureException with the specified exception message.
      Parameters:
      map - the map to check for emptiness
      exceptionMessage - the message to include in the exception if the map is empty
      Throws:
      EnsureException - if the map is null or empty

    • notEmpty

      public static void notEmpty(Map<?,?> map) throws EnsureException
      Validates that the provided map is not empty. If the map is null or empty, an EnsureException will be thrown with a specified error message.
      Parameters:
      map - the map to be checked for emptiness; must not be null or empty
      Throws:
      EnsureException - with the message "map must not be empty" - if the provided map is null or empty

    • notEmpty

      public static void notEmpty(Object[] array, Supplier<RuntimeException> supplier) throws RuntimeException
      Validates that the given array is not empty. If the array is null or empty, the provided supplier is used to throw an exception.
      Parameters:
      array - the array to check for non-emptiness
      supplier - the supplier providing the exception to be thrown if validation fails
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the array is null or empty

    • notEmpty

      public static void notEmpty(Object[] array, String exceptionMessage) throws EnsureException
      Checks if the provided array is not empty. If the array is empty, throws an EnsureException with the provided exception message.
      Parameters:
      array - the array to check for non-emptiness
      exceptionMessage - the message to include in the exception if the array is empty
      Throws:
      EnsureException - if the array is empty

    • notEmpty

      public static void notEmpty(Object[] array) throws EnsureException
      Ensures that the provided array is not empty. If the array is empty, an EnsureException is thrown.
      Parameters:
      array - the array to be checked
      Throws:
      EnsureException - with the message "array must not be empty" - if the array is empty

    • max

      public static int max(int max, int n, Supplier<RuntimeException> supplier) throws RuntimeException
      Compares the provided number with a specified maximum value and throws a runtime exception if the number exceeds the maximum.
      Parameters:
      max - the maximum allowable value
      n - the number to compare against the maximum
      supplier - a supplier for creating the runtime exception to be thrown if the provided number exceeds the maximum
      Returns:
      the provided number if it does not exceed the maximum
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the provided number exceeds the maximum value

    • max

      public static int max(int max, int n, String exceptionMessage) throws EnsureException
      Determines the maximum value between the specified integer values, and throws an EnsureException with the provided message if the conditions are not met.
      Parameters:
      max - the current maximum value to compare against
      n - the new integer value to be compared
      exceptionMessage - the exception message to be used if the exception is thrown
      Returns:
      the greater of max and n
      Throws:
      EnsureException - if the conditions for returning the maximum value fail

    • max

      public static int max(int max, int n) throws EnsureException
      Compares two integers and ensures the second integer is less than or equal to the first integer.
      Parameters:
      max - the maximum allowable value
      n - the value to compare against the maximum
      Returns:
      the maximum value if the condition is met
      Throws:
      EnsureException - with the message "value must be less than or equal to %d, but was %d" - if the given value exceeds the maximum allowable value

    • min

      public static int min(int min, int n, Supplier<RuntimeException> supplier) throws RuntimeException
      Compares a value against a minimum threshold and throws a supplied exception if the value is less than the threshold.
      Parameters:
      min - the minimum threshold value
      n - the value to compare against the minimum
      supplier - the supplier that provides the runtime exception to be thrown if the comparison fails
      Returns:
      the value of n if it is greater than or equal to the minimum threshold
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - the exception supplied by the supplier, thrown when the value is less than the minimum threshold

    • min

      public static int min(int min, int n, String exceptionMessage) throws EnsureException
      Compares the given integers and ensures that the second integer is not less than the minimum value, throwing an exception with a specified message if the condition is violated.
      Parameters:
      min - the minimum value to compare against
      n - the value to be compared to the minimum value
      exceptionMessage - the message to use for the exception if the condition is not met
      Returns:
      the greater value between the specified minimum value and the provided integer
      Throws:
      EnsureException - if the provided integer is less than the minimum value

    • min

      public static int min(int min, int n) throws EnsureException
      Compares two integers and ensures that the given value is greater than or equal to the defined minimum.
      Parameters:
      min - the minimum allowed value
      n - the value to compare against the minimum
      Returns:
      the minimum value, or throws an exception if the condition is not met
      Throws:
      EnsureException - with the message "value must be greater than or equal to %d, but was %d" - if the value is less than the specified minimum

    • notBlank

      public static String notBlank(String s, Supplier<RuntimeException> supplier) throws RuntimeException
      Ensures that the provided string is not blank. If the string is blank or null, the specified exception supplied by the supplier is thrown.
      Parameters:
      s - the string to be validated as not blank
      supplier - the supplier that provides the exception to throw if the string is blank
      Returns:
      the validated string if it is not blank
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the string is blank or null, provided by the supplier

    • notBlank

      public static String notBlank(String s, String exceptionMessage) throws EnsureException
      Ensures that the provided string is not blank. If the string is blank or null, an exception is thrown with the provided exception message.
      Parameters:
      s - the string to check for being non-blank
      exceptionMessage - the message to include in the thrown exception if the string is blank
      Returns:
      the original string if it is not blank
      Throws:
      EnsureException - if the string is blank

    • notBlank

      public static String notBlank(String s) throws EnsureException
      Ensures that the provided string is not blank. If the string is blank or null, an exception is thrown with a default message.
      Parameters:
      s - the string to validate
      Returns:
      the original string if it is not blank
      Throws:
      EnsureException - with the message - "string must not be blank" if the string is blank

    • notNullOrElseGet

      public static <T> T notNullOrElseGet(T obj, Supplier<T> supplier) throws EnsureException
      Returns the given object if it is not null; otherwise, it evaluates and returns the result from the supplied Supplier. If the supplier is null or produces a null value, it throws an EnsureException.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the object being checked
      Parameters:
      obj - the object to check for non-nullity
      supplier - the supplier to provide an alternative object if obj is null
      Returns:
      the non-null obj, or the value provided by the supplier if obj is null
      Throws:
      EnsureException - if the supplier is null or produces a null value

    • notNullOrElse

      public static <T> T notNullOrElse(T obj, T defaultObj)
      Returns the provided object if it is not null; otherwise, returns the given default object.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the objects being evaluated
      Parameters:
      obj - the object to check for nullity
      defaultObj - the default object to return if obj is null
      Returns:
      obj if it is not null, otherwise defaultObj

    • notNullOrElseThrow

      public static <T> T notNullOrElseThrow(T obj, Supplier<RuntimeException> supplier) throws RuntimeException
      Ensures that the specified object is not null. If the object is null, a RuntimeException provided by the given supplier is thrown.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the object being checked
      Parameters:
      obj - the object to check for nullity
      supplier - the supplier that provides a RuntimeException to be thrown if the object is null
      Returns:
      the non-null object
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if the object is null and the supplier provides an exception

    • notNullOrElseThrow

      public static <T> T notNullOrElseThrow(T obj) throws RuntimeException
      Ensures that the given object is not null, and returns the object if it is non-null. If the object is null, this method throws a RuntimeException.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the object
      Parameters:
      obj - the object to be checked for nullity
      Returns:
      the non-null object passed as input
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - with the message "object must not be null" - if the object is null

    • notNull

      public static void notNull(Object obj, Supplier<RuntimeException> supplier) throws RuntimeException
      Ensures that the provided object is not null. If the object is null, a RuntimeException provided by the given Supplier is thrown.
      Parameters:
      obj - the object to be checked for non-nullity
      supplier - the supplier responsible for providing the RuntimeException to be thrown if obj is null
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if obj is null, with the exception derived from the supplier

    • notNull

      public static void notNull(Object obj, String message) throws EnsureException
      Ensures that the provided object is not null. If the object is null, an EnsureException with the given message is thrown.
      Parameters:
      obj - the object to be checked for non-nullity
      message - the exception message to be included if obj is null
      Throws:
      EnsureException - if obj is null

    • notNull

      public static void notNull(Object obj) throws EnsureException
      Ensures that the provided object is not null. If the object is null, an EnsureException is thrown.
      Parameters:
      obj - the object to be checked for non-nullity
      Throws:
      EnsureException - with the message "object must not be null" - if obj is null

    • isTrue

      public static void isTrue(boolean expression, Supplier<RuntimeException> supplier) throws RuntimeException
      Validates that the given boolean expression is true. If the expression evaluates to false, a RuntimeException provided by the specified Supplier is thrown.
      Parameters:
      expression - the boolean expression to be evaluated
      supplier - the supplier responsible for providing the RuntimeException to be thrown if expression evaluates to false
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if expression evaluates to false, with the exception derived from the supplier

    • isTrue

      public static void isTrue(boolean expression, String exceptionMessage) throws EnsureException
      Ensures that the provided expression evaluates to true. If the expression evaluates to false, an EnsureException is thrown with the provided exception message.
      Parameters:
      expression - the boolean expression to be evaluated
      exceptionMessage - the exception message to be included if the expression evaluates to false
      Throws:
      EnsureException - if expression evaluates to false

    • isTrue

      public static void isTrue(boolean b) throws EnsureException
      Ensures that the provided boolean value is true. If the value is false, an EnsureException with a default message is thrown.
      Parameters:
      b - the boolean value to check; must be true
      Throws:
      EnsureException - with the message "boolean must be true" - if the provided value is false

    • isFalse

      public static void isFalse(boolean b, Supplier<RuntimeException> supplier) throws RuntimeException
      Ensures that the provided boolean value is false. If the value is true, a RuntimeException provided by the given Supplier is thrown.
      Parameters:
      b - the boolean value to check
      supplier - the supplier responsible for providing the RuntimeException to be thrown if b is true
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - if b is true, with the exception derived from the supplier

    • isFalse

      public static void isFalse(boolean b, String exceptionMessage) throws EnsureException
      Ensures that the provided boolean value is false. If the value is true, an EnsureException with the provided exception message is thrown.
      Parameters:
      b - the boolean value to be checked
      exceptionMessage - the exception message to include if b is true
      Throws:
      EnsureException - if b is true

    • isFalse

      public static void isFalse(boolean b) throws EnsureException
      Ensures that the provided boolean value is false. If the value is true, an EnsureException with a default message is thrown.
      Parameters:
      b - the boolean value to be checked
      Throws:
      EnsureException - with the message "boolean must be false" - if b is true
